author: dao.coders
title: Merchandise Store pricing in ADA
description: Custom T-shirts are a common way to raise brand awareness and funds online however sales are not done in ADA due to exchange volatility.

f6_assessments.q0: The project tries to create a smart contract that will use a third-party oracle to determine the exchange rate between ADA and the stable coin or cryptocurrency that the merchandise is priced in, then the smart contract will provide the real-time price. The proposed solution is important in answering problems in the challenge. The team also provides the potential risk of determining the exchange rate between ADA and a stable coin. The team provide a reasonable way to overcome them and a preferred solution using stable coin such as djed.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a detailed plan and roadmap for what will they do each month starting from May to October 2022. The team provides details of how they will use the proposed budget, remuneration for the developer and project manager are reasonable. However, the 10K$ Third Party Smart Contract Audit can be broken down into more details. The team also elaborates background, relevant skills, and experience on each people on the team and provide a LinkedIn profile for all member.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal state they will use the GitHub repository to track development progress and thus the community can see the progress as well. However, the proposal does not provide a link to the GitHub repository and would be better if they do so. The Metrics and KPIs for success are concise and clearly defined by five criteria.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge addresses a big part of the B2C community in supporting merchandise stores implementing a pricing in ADA. It affects also other processes in online shopping industries which could be scaled to use in other use cases than just merchandising. The use case and process description is written clearly and states the benefits and risk for this proposal. The proposal also gives clear answers to benefits of efficiency and safety fort he parties involved in trying to lower volatility and creating clear and straight forward rules for executing the smart contracts. I think this proposal suits perfectly in the goals of the challenge by providing goodwill to companies and community (producer & consumer)
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal clearly states goals and mile stones that can be archived by the mentioned team. The team´s experiences are closely matched to their tasks and a structure of the team is clear. All members bring in quite a good experience in different areas of the crypto space and tasks that need to be done in this project. The team also seems to have experience together as they already worked together on previous proposals that were also accepted. The budget is clear and realistic and also supports the laid out goals to successfully finish the project.
f6_assessments.q2: A few quantitative measures are mentioned where progress of the proposal can be seen. To really round up everything together the KPIs should be structured clearer and show the community on first look basis what needs to be achieved to succesfully finish the project. External auditions supports the KPI system mentioned and could clear open points from community. All in all the quantitative measures are not perfectly set up but will do quite well to document progress.

f6_assessments.q0: A potential project often has to know based on the actual situation of the market and find ways to solve the problems that arise. And the project of this proposal did it well. But often speaking will not convince the fastidious investors, so this proposal provides a sample transaction to increase the persuasion and illustrate the function of the project. Moreover, the proposal also anticipates the risks that will directly affect the project’s future and seek to address them. Although it's not the best way, I still appreciate that your team listens and intends this project to be a solution investigation if Djed may offer some solution options that will simplify this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Your team has talented and experienced members, so the proposed budget is worth their ability and what they've done (I can see their enthusiasm through the presentable Impact part above). The roadmap is also outlined with a complete timeline and leading activities. However, I think it is necessary to add a few more details to specify these activities because the Feasibility part of a good proposal must show a reasonable plan in terms of what they will accomplish and how it needs to be.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal shows the reader what the success of this project will look like through specific and transparent criteria. The way to track project progress and quantitative indicators are also provided for the community to have a basis to monitor the project's development. However, I hope this proposal can have more specific KPIs to define how successful this proposal will be based on numbers. I will give this part 5 points because I see the team’s seriousness, but I still hope it can be better.
